snippet: Taxing wealth — household assets like property, stocks, art and yachts — in addition to income may be a way to make sure the rich contribute a higher share to government coffers.
abstract: Some economists say raising marginal income tax rates on high earners may miss the mark; point out that taxing wealth--household assets like property, stocks, art and yachts--in addition to income may be a way to make sure rich contribute higher share to government coffers.
lead_paragraph: Taxing wealth — household assets like property, stocks, art and yachts — in addition to income may be a way to make sure the rich contribute a higher share to government coffers.

headline.seo: A Wealth Tax Would Look Beyond Income
headline.main: Looking Beyond Income, to a Tax on Wealth
headline.print_headline: Looking Beyond Income, Toward a Tax on Wealth Itself
